definition: decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate

sentences.english: All the camouflage of the spies cannot escape his sharp eyes.
sentences.chinese: 奸细所有的伪饰都逃不过他锐利的眼睛。

sentences.english: Itdisguises the word's origins just enough to keep the swearer clear of the law.
sentences.chinese: 它伪饰单词的起源，使得脏话能够不受法律的限制。

sentences.english: What is a man's duty?The answer is brief: To be himself.
sentences.chinese: 人的第一天职是什么？答案很简单，就是不伪饰自己。

sentences.english: Today, the society is highly developed and the level of disguise also reaches a peak.
sentences.chinese: 时至今日，社会文明高度发达，伪饰也达到登峰造极。

sentences.english: History of social civilization is really a complete history of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 社会文明史其实就是完整的伪饰史。

definition: to paint/to whitewash/to decorate/plaster/fig. to gloss over/to cover up
to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to pretend that everything is going well
